New Records: The Cavs' 136 points are the most the team has EVER scored in a season opener.
The Cavs' 136 points are the most the team has ever scored in a non-overtime regular season road game.
Key Match Events: Evan Mobley's game-high 25 points led six Cavs players who scored in double figures.

Donovan Mitchell added 21 points, three assists, three steals, and one block, and LeVert led the bench with 19 points and four assists as six of the Cavs players scored in double figures against the Raptors.
Pre-Game Insights: Kenny Atkinson texted Caris LeVert about his multifaceted role this upcoming season.
Atkinson wanted to prepare LeVert for anything and everything, as the ebbs and flows of an NBA regular season would dictate the ever-changing roles.
Post-Match Reflections: Jarrett Allen alluded to the team's solid defense and offense after the win.
Atkinson praised LeVert as the ultimate team guy, ultimate high-character player.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavs shot at a 58.6% clip from the floor, 14-of-30 from deep (46.7%).
They scored 30+ points in all four quarters.
